Package se.arkalix.util

Class Result<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.util.Result<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of value provided by Result if successful.
    public class Result<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    The result of an operation that can either succeed or fail.

    A Result may either be a success, in which case a value is available, or a failure, which makes an fault available. The isSuccess() method is used to determine which of the two situations is the case. The value() and fault() methods are used to collect the value or fault, respectively.

    This type is especially appropriate to use when throwing exceptions do not cause them to end up at the initiator of the execution in question. This is often the case when dealing with thread pools, as the threads in such pools can do nothing to meaningfully handle exceptions thrown while they are executing.

      • value

        public V value()

      • valueOrThrow

        public V valueOrThrow()
        Either returns Result value or throws its fault, depending on whether it is successful or not.

        In the case of being a failure, the fault is thrown as-is if it is a subclass of RuntimeException. If not, it is wrapped in a RuntimeException before being thrown.

        Returns:
        Result value, if the Result is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the Result is a failure.

      • ifSuccess

        public void ifSuccess​(java.util.function.Consumer<? super V> consumer)
        Calls given consumer only if this result is successful.
        Parameters:
        consumer - Consumer function to call, if successful.

      • ifFailure

        public void ifFailure​(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Throwable> consumer)
        Calls given consumer only if this result is a failure.
        Parameters:
        consumer - Consumer function to call, if not successful.

      • map

        public <U> Result<U> map​(java.util.function.Function<? super V,​U> mapper)
        If this result is successful, applies given mapper to its value. Otherwise, a new Result with the fault contained in this one is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Type of return value of mapper.
        Parameters:
        mapper - Function to apply to result value, if this result is successful.
        Returns:
        New result containing either output of mapping or an fault passed on from this result.

      • flatMap

        public <U> Result<U> flatMap​(java.util.function.Function<? super V,​? extends Result<U>> mapper)
        If this result is successful, applies given mapper to its value, and then returns the Result returned by the mapper. If this result is not successful, a new Result with the fault it contains is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Type of value of Result returned by mapper.
        Parameters:
        mapper - Function to apply to result value, if this result is successful.
        Returns:
        New result consisting either of result of mapper or an fault passed on from this result.
